blocks.name: tb-ax1
blocks.content: The first of three axioms in the Tarski-Bernays axiom system. (Contributed by Anthony Hart, 16-Aug-2011.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: tb-ax2
blocks.content: The second of three axioms in the Tarski-Bernays axiom system. (Contributed by Anthony Hart, 16-Aug-2011.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: tb-ax3
blocks.content: The third of three axioms in the Tarski-Bernays axiom system. This axiom, along with ~ ax-mp , ~ tb-ax1 , and ~ tb-ax2 , can be used to derive any theorem or rule that uses only ` -> ` . (Contributed by Anthony Hart, 16-Aug-2011.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: tbsyl
blocks.content: The weak syllogism from Tarski-Bernays'. (Contributed by Anthony Hart, 16-Aug-2011.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: re1ax2lem
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ re1ax2 . (Contributed by Anthony Hart, 16-Aug-2011.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm re1ax2lem(wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) {
  |- wi(wi(w0, wi(w1, w2)), wi(w1, wi(w0, w2)))
} = {
  mpsyl(wi(w0, wi(w1, w2)), wi(w1, wi(w0, w2)), wi(w1, wi(wi(w1, w2), w2)), wi(wi(wi(w1, w2), w2), wi(w0, w2)))
  tbsyl(w1, wi(wi(w1, w2), w2), wi(wi(w1, w2), wi(wi(w1, w2), w2)))
  tbsyl(w1, wi(wi(w1, w2), wi(wi(w1, w2), w2)), wi(wi(w1, w2), w1))
  tb-ax2(w1, wi(w1, w2))
  tb-ax1(wi(w1, w2), w1, w2)
  tbsyl(wi(wi(w1, w2), wi(wi(w1, w2), w2)), wi(wi(w1, w2), w2), wi(wi(wi(wi(w1, w2), w2), w2), wi(wi(w1, w2), w2)))
  tb-ax1(wi(w1, w2), wi(wi(w1, w2), w2), w2)
  tb-ax3(wi(wi(w1, w2), w2), w2)
  tb-ax1(w0, wi(w1, w2), w2)
  tb-ax1(w1, wi(wi(w1, w2), w2), wi(w0, w2))
}

blocks.name: re1ax2
blocks.content: ~ ax-2 rederived from the Tarski-Bernays axiom system. Often ~ tb-ax1 is replaced with this theorem to make a "standard" system. This is because this theorem is easier to work with, despite it being longer. (Contributed by Anthony Hart, 16-Aug-2011.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm re1ax2(wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) {
  |- wi(wi(w0, wi(w1, w2)), wi(wi(w0, w1), wi(w0, w2)))
} = {
  tbsyl(wi(w0, wi(w1, w2)), wi(wi(w0, w1), wi(w0, w2)), wi(w1, wi(w0, w2)))
  re1ax2lem(w0, w1, w2)
  mpsyl(wi(w1, wi(w0, w2)), wi(wi(w0, w1), wi(w0, w2)), wi(wi(w0, wi(w0, w2)), wi(w0, w2)), wi(wi(w0, w1), wi(w0, wi(w0, w2))))
  tbsyl(wi(w0, wi(w0, w2)), wi(w0, w2), wi(wi(wi(w0, w2), w2), wi(w0, w2)))
  tb-ax1(w0, wi(w0, w2), w2)
  tb-ax3(wi(w0, w2), w2)
  ax-mp(wi(wi(w1, wi(w0, w2)), wi(wi(w0, w1), wi(w0, wi(w0, w2)))), wi(wi(w0, w1), wi(wi(w1, wi(w0, w2)), wi(w0, wi(w0, w2)))))
  tb-ax1(w0, w1, wi(w0, w2))
  re1ax2lem(wi(w0, w1), wi(w1, wi(w0, w2)), wi(w0, wi(w0, w2)))
  ax-mp(wi(wi(wi(w0, wi(w0, w2)), wi(w0, w2)), wi(wi(wi(w0, w1), wi(w0, wi(w0, w2))), wi(wi(w0, w1), wi(w0, w2)))), wi(wi(wi(w0, w1), wi(w0, wi(w0, w2))), wi(wi(wi(w0, wi(w0, w2)), wi(w0, w2)), wi(wi(w0, w1), wi(w0, w2)))))
  tb-ax1(wi(w0, w1), wi(w0, wi(w0, w2)), wi(w0, w2))
  re1ax2lem(wi(wi(w0, w1), wi(w0, wi(w0, w2))), wi(wi(w0, wi(w0, w2)), wi(w0, w2)), wi(wi(w0, w1), wi(w0, w2)))
}

blocks.name: w3nand
blocks.content: The double nand.
blocks.origin: prop wff w3nand(wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) { (w0 ⊼ w1 ⊼ w2) }

blocks.name: diff.w3nand.s
diff.w3nand.c
diff.w3nand.w
df-3nand
blocks.content: The double nand. This definition allows us to express the input of three variables only being false if all three are true. (Contributed by Anthony Hart, 2-Sep-2011.)

blocks.name: df3nandALT1
blocks.content: The double nand expressed in terms of pure nand. (Contributed by Anthony Hart, 2-Sep-2011.)
blocks.origin:
thm df3nandALT1(wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) {
  |- wb(w3nand(w0, w1, w2), wnan(w0, wnan(wnan(w1, w2), wnan(w1, w2))))
} = {
  3bitr4i(w3nand(w0, w1, w2), wnan(w0, wnan(wnan(w1, w2), wnan(w1, w2))), wi(w0, wi(w1, wn(w2))), wn(wa(w0, wnan(wnan(w1, w2), wnan(w1, w2)))))
  3bitr4i(wi(w0, wi(w1, wn(w2))), wn(wa(w0, wnan(wnan(w1, w2), wnan(w1, w2)))), wi(w0, wa(wnan(w1, w2), wnan(w1, w2))), wn(wa(w0, wn(wa(wnan(w1, w2), wnan(w1, w2))))))
  iman(w0, wa(wnan(w1, w2), wnan(w1, w2)))
  imbi2i(w0, wi(w1, wn(w2)), wa(wnan(w1, w2), wnan(w1, w2)))
  bitr4i(wi(w1, wn(w2)), wa(wnan(w1, w2), wnan(w1, w2)), wa(wn(wa(w1, w2)), wn(wa(w1, w2))))
  impbii(wi(w1, wn(w2)), wa(wn(wa(w1, w2)), wn(wa(w1, w2))))
  jca(wi(w1, wn(w2)), wn(wa(w1, w2)), wn(wa(w1, w2)))
  biimpi(wi(w1, wn(w2)), wn(wa(w1, w2)))
  adantl(wn(wa(w1, w2)), wn(wa(w1, w2)), wi(w1, wn(w2)))
  biimpri(wn(wa(w1, w2)), wi(w1, wn(w2)))
  imnan(w1, w2)
  anbi12i(wnan(w1, w2), wnan(w1, w2), wn(wa(w1, w2)), wn(wa(w1, w2)))
  df-nan(w1, w2)
  notbii(wa(w0, wnan(wnan(w1, w2), wnan(w1, w2))), wa(w0, wn(wa(wnan(w1, w2), wnan(w1, w2)))))
  anbi2i(w0, wnan(wnan(w1, w2), wnan(w1, w2)), wn(wa(wnan(w1, w2), wnan(w1, w2))))
  df-nan(wnan(w1, w2), wnan(w1, w2))
  df-3nand(w0, w1, w2)
  df-nan(w0, wnan(wnan(w1, w2), wnan(w1, w2)))
}

blocks.name: df3nandALT2
blocks.content: The double nand expressed in terms of negation and and not. (Contributed by Anthony Hart, 13-Sep-2011.)

blocks.name: andnand1

blocks.name: imnand2
